But nothing ever appeared. Its just a vacuous waste. I can't even imagine what the producers were thinking, let alone the director. I have seen movies almost this bad, but fortunately not often. There really is nothing I have to say in a positive way about this movie, even the ending is depressing; it just points out the futility and emptiness of living a self-centered life. Avoid this movie.

reviews.review_title: Please don't drag your Boyfriend to this .. we shouldn't suffer as well
reviews.content: From never seen a single episode of Sex in the City, I was dragged to this on a Sunday afternoon by my fiancée'. What happened next was close to having my happy chap being slammed in between bricks for 2 hrs+.As far as I can tell these super rich women that have zero grasp of reality are in a group that spend their time shopping, slating their bf;s/husbands and generally doing sweet fa for loads of money.The general plot line , if there is such a thing seems to be Samantha (the slutty one)a publicist gets invited by a Arab hotel owner all expenses to review and help with the hotels image. She somehow drags along horse faced parker, the scary looking ginge and the dark haired dense one.What happens next is Red Rum Parker does a costume change every 5 mins, like wearing a ball gown in a boiling hot middle eastern market..? why??? The slutty one trying to simply get more rides than a Blackpool roller-coaster, The dense dark haired one dealing with her inner emotion of being a mother and the ginge's passion for knowledge and learning.( on a note how she managed to stay pasty white and not burn to a crisp throughout the film is beyond me)2 hrs of this crap... seriously!.. queue a sub plot of the old one being done for having sex on a beach ( wow didn't see that coming )and the '3:15 from Donnington' Parker kissing some random man,even some slow-mo scene involving the Austrialian rugby team!? Every actress seems to milks every screen minute to show how pretty and flowing they can make any dress look. It's beyond me how scenes like the condom market scene or the frankly insulting beyond belief Gucci under burkhas scene was kept in. Did the writers seriously expect us believe that such a character (Samantha) would have no respect for another countries traditions or rules?? I'm not a woman so I cant understand the appeal this series gets.Horse face Parker should be given some sort of uber award for managing to milk 2 films and multiple series out of this crap. On a finishing note- It was way too long, had little or no plot, wooden acting and borderline racist ideas for plot fillers, If your a woman and you loved the series - fine go watch it, my fiancée thinks its personally better than the first so if your a uber fan you'll prob love it.
All the women need to get a refund for the bad plastic surgery! Yuck!! Or they are just all really unattractive!

Glamour, excitement and a plot that - in the end - almost turns a chick flick into an action movie. The papers are full of articles titled "Why I won't be seeing Sex and the City 2" but I'm here to change your mind. Two years on, the 4 BFFs have moved on from their single lives and face pressures from husbands, employers, children and nannies. Of course, Samantha doesn't have to worry about any of these as she remains a wild child throughout the sequel. The first part of the movie is "all work, no play" for all 4 characters whereas the second part is set in Abu Dhabi where "PARTY TIME" begins! Over-the-top details include Liza Minnelli singing a Beyonce song (which is also kind of genius) and Arabic women wearing the entire collection of one of the highest priced brands. If you think it's too much then you can prepare yourself in advance because it doesn't get more out of hand than that. Wilder, yes, but more out of hand, no! Most movie critics tell us what a disappointment this movie is, but we have to face facts: the sequel topped the first film and even the series! I might not be talking about the profit the newest addition to the franchise have made but the storyline is certainly more exciting. Maybe it's just me and all those sparkly accessories blinded me, but the first time left me craving for more and I am already planning my next visit to the cinema. Stop reading those bad reviews and stop giving yourself excuses why you shouldn't invite your friends to come and see this blockbuster with you. It's worth every penny and even if it doesn't – you know the rule -, you won't know until you try! By Alexandra Pamukov, a wanna-be movie critic

reviews.review_title: I have never laughed so much, amazing movie
reviews.content: Some of the scenes are hilarious.... I really neeeeeeed 3 part of the movie... Love love love sex in the city is the best of the best

SEX AND THE CITY 2 by Nigel HareOpening with a gay wedding, apt film to watch as just legal here in GB, this movie moves from glamorous set piece to glamorous set piece. The opulence and consumption knows no bounds. I've seen a little of the TV shows but not the first movie. The singleton ladies are now married, except the nymph Samantha, and two have children but it is the same Sex in the City. Girlfriend said to me "you like your crap and I like mine": this movie is just another kind of crap. She enjoyed it and I just wouldn't go that far but I didn't run from the room with horror or 'chew through one of my limbs' to survive the experience

I watched this movie as wife really wanted to see it. Let's put it this way - even if you get a free pirated version of the movie - still do not waste your time on this crap! I do not understand how did this movie made over 286 million. This is nothing but a story about 4 mid-aged women trying and acting like teens and it was PURE torture.This movie was disrespectful portrayal of North American women and an insult to foreign cultures.Do yourself a favour - if you happen to be in a situation where you cannot avoid watching this movie - take a few sleeping pills beforehand! You will thank me later.

If you are looking to reconnect with your favorite SATC characters, KEEP LOOKING. The ones in this movie are pale imitations of the characters we grew to love. It was tediously long and boring. The costumes were terrible, the locations under utilized, and the script seems to have been pieced together from half ideas jotted down on post it notes.It won't satisfy your desire for quick wit and interesting characters from the past. Stream the original series instead.

reviews.review_title: Seems like a very poorly made super cheesy Bollywood movie!
reviews.content: I am a big fan of Bollywood films. But I just can't stand a poorly made one. And Sex and the City 2 was just that. The film does not have any story. The actors and actresses change into exotic clothes for no reason. The scenes suddenly break into poorly composed dance and song numbers. The film takes us to "exotic" locations completely out of context. Actors are unnecessarily loud and melodramatic. There is a bucketful of stupid, unnecessary sentimentality in every scene. There are ton of product placements and the whole movie seems like a one big commercial. Sex and the City 2 is not worth watching even on a pirated DVD, let alone in theaters. I feel let down. I want my money back. I am giving this a two star and not one star because of the conversation Charlotte and Miranda have over a glass of champagne on woes of parenting.

reviews.review_title: Sex And The City -I am a woman
reviews.content: I'm a woman. I'm 22. I watched SATC series, and not just once. I have the whole collection at home so i can watch it whenever i want. So, you can say I'm a true fan. I know every episode, and every joke. I watch the movie yesterday, and i loved it. I loved Carrrie, Samantha, Charlotte and Miranda. I didn't like the first movie. This is show about women, strong, independent women, not about woman get left by altar and crying for a year.I didn't like the first movie. This is show about women, strong, independent women, not about woman get left by altar and crying for a year.I don't get why everyone is surprised with this movie, it's based on series. The humor is from series. I don't get how u didn't find it, at least, funny. To me it was hilarious. Me and my friends laughed the whole 2 and half hours. Common people, the Jude Law joke?!I like it, and i'm gonna watch it again, because to me, it was fabulous.And if you liked series, Samanhas nasty jokes, Charlottes moralism, Miranda the control freak, and Carrie-the glue, you have to love this movie. The girls are not shallow, they are who they were in the series. If you can't remember them-go and see the series again, to be reminded. The way they behave in Abu Dhabi is completely expected from them. It has humor, it has emotion, it has love, it reminds us of good old times, and most important it has friendship.

reviews.review_title: An excellent movie, Funny and thought provoking
reviews.content: I loved this movie. Like many women who have had children I found the scene with Charlotte locking herself away from the kids so familiar as would many other mothers. Samantha, thank heavens, was still her great self. The 'one liners' that have been written for this character have stood the test of time. My daughter said that it brought back memories of me in the scene where her bag is stolen and she is giving all these clerics the bird and telling them exactly what she thinks. The fashion was magnificent. I was pleased to see that they resurrected some of the previous outfits for this movie.Hilariously deals with ,menopause, religion, men, marriage and life. Job well done

I loved the series because it talked of dating and marriage woes. While I make good money I'd never spend it on Monolos, parties etc. it was always fun to live vicariously through these over privileged women. What I hated about the film is that it showcased all of these women as over-privileged spoiled brats. How nice it would be to have a nanny. How nice it would be to only worry about who you're going to boink or what mindless party the husband who pays for your spending habits doesn't want to attend. I give credit to Miranda because she works her ass off in her profession. Charlotte cares about her girls but like so many parents gets Overwhelmed. But, they all have far more resources at their disposal than most women. The cultural insensitivity would take two many paragraphs. This film is tone deaf and doesn't do justice to the series.

reviews.review_title: J'adore Le Sex and le City !
reviews.content: "Sex and the City 2" was, to say this first of all, mostly not like I expected it to be when I was watching the Trailers etc. The Story might be not that great, but what "Big" Drama's do we want to see now after they said "I do" ? The Aidan thing was pretty clever, and actually I thought there didn't happen enough ! A kiss is just not enough ! The End of the movie fails a little bit, it's to fast and it comes without a warning. It's like: So that's the story, thanks for watching and BOOM Credits roll in ... I wasn't anticipating that the story would be the important thing in this movie, it's about the Girls, it always was this way and I hope will stay this way for a third Part. The actors are as great as always ... sure they got old, but they still kick ass. I love the Soundtrack, the clothes, the fun, the friendship, the guys and of course the gals. And at least the story was still so much more fun than the first one ! All that Drama is gone and now Carrie and Mr. Big are just a married couple, but nothing about Big cheating on Carrie is true ! Don't know if that was a PR Gag or something ... but at least it isn't that way around in the movie. And be sure that Samantha with a menopause, however will still be Samantha and there are some freakin' hot guys in Abu-Dhabi. Miley Cyrus is also pretty sweet in her 50 Seconds on Screen. The best Thing in the whole movie are the set's ! The Hotel and everything they experience in Abu-Dhabi is so beautiful. It's exactly as good as the first movie was.If you loved the first one ... you'll die for this !

This bimbo movie dragged on for an eternity. Certainly it was written by a 'dumb blonde.' Why me, God? were my thoughts as things just got worse. I told my wife, 'any movie you want this time Honey' - wrong thing to say! The actors, producer, director, and whomever OK'd and bankrolled this movie should be shot in the stomach and then killed! I've only seen one or two movies in my entire life that were as bad as this. There was only one slight redeeming value - some nice boobs.As you are about to go into the door to the theater, do yourself a huge favor and turn 180 degrees and go into the movie that's playing next door. Any movie. Because, it can't get any worse than this.Stay away! Run! Hide!

reviews.review_title: Light, easy, clear...what else do you need?
reviews.content: After reading all these negative reviews about the movie I was pretty pessimistic, but hello, it wasn't bad at all...Just like the series,the movie is very kind, very encouraging and even relaxing. You see the same smiles of the women who were actually never supposed to be awkwardly beautiful and are just getting naturally older. They have always played the roles of just normal, ordinary women. And they do it nicely. Well, I agree that in comparison to the series the movie was a little shallow at some moments, but again what is so bad about it? You get something different, kind of a new approach to the life of the same people. But the language remained the same, and that is absolutely one of the greatest thing about the whole project.All in all, I was feeling relaxed and not bored during the movie and after it.

I managed to avoid this title during its cinematic release as I was hearing a lot of negative reviews from friends and critics alike. I was a huge fan of the television series, but the first film was a bit of a let down, not only for its predictable storyline but also for the new roles they'd written in, such as Jennifer Hudson's pointless and overly sugared character, or the wasted celluloid hours spent on admiring Carrie's wardrobe and dropping in as many designer names as possible. The sequel however, avoids all these errors and for me watching it was just as enjoyable as my SATC boxset marathons. A lot of the criticism levied at the film revolved around the fact that (nearly) all of the four main characters are now happily married and who would be interested in hearing their stories? Well, actually a fair few I imagine. What DOES happen when the initial sizzle goes out of a marriage and all you do is sit around at home watching TV and settle in to the routine of middle age? Seeing Carrie and Big interact as husband and wife and work that out, whilst also seeing Carrie struggle with the normality of marriage was a great extension to the series.I never thought I'd say this but I'm actually hoping for a third. Although as I did with this one, I will definitely wait for the DVD.

Don't waste your time to watch this. It's just a Strangely exaggerated advertising of Abu DhabiA.
Not a movie at all!

reviews.review_title: Stop them before they change again!
reviews.content: Ah, the 'Sex and the City' franchise. The TV and film collection that asks the question (over and over and over and...) "What the HELL are they wearing?"No surprises in this film sequel. From the streets of New York to the souks of Abu Dhabi (aka Morocco), you can hear the puzzled masses cry out in the wake of our girls: "WTF was that????"And hey, there's lots of bonus material, too. We get the schizophrenic position on Abu Dhabi. First it's an Abu Dhabi love fest, then, well, not so much. What happened, guys, did the Abu Dhabi funding pull out when they got a load of the outfits? And as anticipated, Kim Catrell's vagina is back. So much so that it should probably have its own billing in the credits. Ah, that wacky vagina! The blatant product placement you may remember from the first movie is back, too. But this time, it's not only product placement. This time, we get whole segments of dialog dedicated to product promotion. Long segments of dialog. Entire scenes, even. In fact, probably two thirds of the movie is basically a bunch of infomercials strung together.Okay, well anyway, long story short, I'd say borrow the DVD (don't rent, don't buy) and play drinking games - every time the girls change outfits, every time Kim Catrell mentions that wacky vagina, every time Carrie wears something stupid (is there that much alcohol IN THE WORLD?), every blatant product promotion, every time the movie makes you feel just plain uneasy - there's just so much opportunity here. Don't let it go to waste. But here's a brief public service announcement: Don't drink and dress. I think that might be Carrie's problem.

reviews.review_title: I don't get it - I LOVED IT!
reviews.content: Let me preface this with I'm a Sex & the City fan. Big fan. Watched all of the seasons at least 4x each. I would watch them before getting ready for work for fashion inspiration! I could watch them all again right now. That's it, I'm going home...I feel like I'm going to be hit with designer imposter bags for saying this, but I REALLY enjoyed the movie. I liked it better than the first one! My girlfriend felt the same way. We were talking about all of the parts we loved on the way to the car, to our friends, to our work pals.Ouch, put the talons away harpies. I don't understand why everyone is so disappointed. I laughed, I guffawed, I even got the vapors at moments. I even spoke out loud when I was laughing, and please note, that is not typical behavior for me. I flippin' loved it! Yeah, New York wasn't featured as a key player this time. But when it comes to big cities and fashion nowadays, there are trendier cities people! Some times NY gets tired. But I also loved the LA trip, the Paris trip, and the Hamptons in the series. I think featuring the UAE was very cool of them.Everything was so over-the-top and lavish! I feel that is what defined what Sex & the City in the beginning. The fashion and the lifestyle. Colorful, decadent, unattainable, unaffordable, fabulous! And when they did the 'real' moments with the girls, I felt connected to them on a more realistic level.I think this movie gave me everything - the fashion, the sex (which wasn't often, but hey, they've grown up a bit) the shopping. Maybe the original SATC fans have just changed and become more conservative...Ladies? Possibly? I thought the movie was fun, hilarious and extravagant. Plan on seeing it in theaters again and buying the DVD. Love 'em all and their blessed faults.

reviews.review_title: One hand in the air for the big movie!
reviews.content: I don't think anyone said that this would be the quality film of the year! I mean anyone tries to be so censorious! And OK... I agree that the scenario, the plot were not that good (actually were bad) , but when I learned that a second movie is being shot, I never thought "I want SO bad to see the scenario, the plot, the direction, how good the actors are!", although these things do matter! However, I thought "I want to see the girls, New York City, Abu Dhabi (which turned out to be Morocco), clothes, shoes, glamour, hilarious quotes, Samantha having sex, Charlotte being drunk, Miranda organizing the trip and Carrie kissing Aidan!" To be honest, as a movie it takes a 4, but as far as Sex and the City factor is concerned, it takes an 8! And as a fan of the series and the first movie: I LOVED IT!

So I'm not a big fan of SATC, I didn't watch all the series, but I watched the first movie with my friend/big fan and it was mediocre movies, nothing special. So, I went to the movies to see sequel, i was expecting something really bad according to the critics. But oh my god, I'm really shocked, cause I like movies that means something and I+m a big fan of movies, and SATC2 was like a fresh breeze for me. I was laughing all the time, movie has a point, a moral point, it's funny, it's so much funnier than the first. I really really enjoyed it, and I'm like DICK SPRIT, i LOVE Samantha. So because of this movie I will watch series. They convinced me, so much love in this movie, so much laughs. Like they are my friends. I REALLY recommend this movie.

well, I am happy to see the girls, or should i say the ladies, again, no doubt. But when i saw these faces, the walk, the eyes, i can't help to regret that i spend the money for my ticket. THEY ARE REALLY OLD!!!! and yes i know the marriage shouldn't be full of drama, yes, its OK that there are no real stories behind the movie, but these small things with carrie and big... its killing me... that is BORING! otherwise charlotte turns out pretty funny, for the first time. i don't think i remember the red head at all, you see, i even cant remember her name! there is nooooooo meaning of her existence in the movie! and i know everything of the show, so thats not a memory problem! samantha, my darling samantha, i know you want to be yourself again, one of the kind, and a little too much. definitely. thats done.generally i don't want to rate the movie badly, but it also is not good. it is kind of flow, you flow above the storyline without being excited or surprised. sometime i am just watching because of the shoes, well, and this pretty goura(?).....
I haven't seen but I'm here to say: Abu Dhabi? Abu Don't Bother.

reviews.review_title: Enjoyed it even through it's MANY flaws
reviews.content: I expected to hate it, based on the scathing reviews, and didn't. I actually enjoyed it. Anyone who's a longtime fan of the series would want to get a fix of time with the four women and their lives, and forgive even the lapses in quality of the film. That being said, by movie standards, and by standards of those who are not fans of the TV show (or first film), the film is almost shockingly inept. Incredibly badly photographed, patchy storyline, contrived plots, inconsistent characters with previous episodes, corny moments, and unnecessarily shallow. But again I enjoyed myself, forgiving the lapses. It was fun to see the girls, who acted like they were enjoying each other, and the ride. Very comforting, in fact. I found, though, that the movie pumped up all the virtues so that everything was too much, too big, too loud, too broad, too shallow, too obvious, too corny. It moved from sophisticated to broad, from incisive look at single New York women who addressed contemporary relationships with men, sex, their work and friendship to more immature hissyfits over nothing. While they looked older, they acted more juvenile than originally written. I felt the clothes, which were always inventive, were gaudy, excessive and, the gravest flaw, were not clothes that Carrie would have actually worn, which was the beauty of the show. The Jump the Shark moment for me was her crinoline with vintage t shirt for the Arabian bazaar, which was preposterous. Carrie would never wear that. It were moments like that where I internally groaned, though, again, was just forgiving, like, Whatever. Ultimately, I loved seeing the girls, the pro-women message, while heavy-handed, was touching, and it made points in reinforcing Carrie and Big's determination to live as an independent couple. Miranda's professional dilemma, however, was unbelievable and uber- contrived. Charlotte's borderline unbelievable and contrived. Mario Cantone would never have let anyone else party-plan his wedding, would never have married Sanford, and that whole sequence looked like a movie set. But as I said, enjoyed it anyway. Hope they get their creative bearings on-track for the third film, which I will still see opening weekend.

I'd heard this film was terrible but I wasn't prepared for how obscenely awful it really is. The most toxic and cynical piece of rubbish I've ever had the mis-fortune of seeing. This is not cinema, this is one long, excruciating nightmare and should not be viewed by anyone. If there was an option to banish slime like this forever I would do it.
Garbage simply garbage.. you want to know the middle east? Go to the middle east !!!

reviews.review_title: Still wonder why everyone hates US?
reviews.content: Well, the movie is so disgusting that I do not even know where to start.4 absolutely useless yuppie byatches who are well past their prime. Excuser moi, but what message I'm supposed to receive from this trash? That it's good to be a wive of some big boss from Wall Street (and who accidentally thinks that she is a "writer" and has some personality just because she writes a stupid column for Vogue (which btw wouldn't cover even 1/10 of her expenses))?Or that having no respect whatsoever for for any culture other than American (I wonder if there is such a thing at all) is something to be proud about? I have certainly seen original "Sex and the Sity" show. And while original show had some charm in it (but byatches were still useless), this is nothing else than just a demonstration of arrogance, filth and disrespect.

I followed the TV series. I saw the first movie. I'm not a fanatic fan, but a fan nonetheless. I thought the series was good, some years better than others, but overall funny, smart and what made it good was TIGHT writing. A lot was delivered in span of that TV show. Not as much was delivered in the first movie, but still enough to keep you hooked. But this one? OMG! It was the WORST movie I have ever seen. Literally. I kept thinking didn't anyone EDIT this script? I almost walked out before it ended, but didn't because I knew Mr. Big would reappear and he's worth just looking at on a big screen. But please...the plot was ludicrious and took us out of 'The City' which IS one of the characters. The acting and character development was so lame, and empty it was like they were all cardboard cutouts of themselves. It lacked '2 year follow-up' and development of the group. They were just 'plopped' down and twirled around until another costume change. If you're going to have a sequel give us something, not just costume changes. Give us the depth the show had. There was SO much that could have been done between the last movie and this. It was about as boring as watching Carrie and Big sit on the couch and watch black and white old movies. No, it was worse than that. It was like watching the make-up dry on Liza Minelli's face.Awful. Stay away from this movie. It's not even worth renting. Skip it. You'll be upset with King for writing this piece of garbage and mad at the actors for selling out and acting (if you can call it that) in it.I had read other reviews on this site and thought, oh, it can't be THAT bad. The last movie got panned, and it was still a fun little romp. And it was. People laughed, cheered, and clapped in that movie. This one, NO ONE in the audience laughed except once. I think they were all in shock like I was wondering what happened to the writing and acting that we were so used to enjoying.

reviews.review_title: It's hard to imagine how this movie could have been worse
reviews.content: To quote Carrie, "oh how the mighty have fallen". This quote applies to the movie on so many levels. What was once an great show, with captivating story lines and decent acting, has turned into an over-the-top, pun-filled (seriously...inter-fun-tion??), 2+ hr display of this season's haute couture. Save your money & buy a Vogue.Also, on a side note, even if they are just making cameo appearances, how do actresses like Liza Minelli & Penelope Cruz go from starring in cinematic masterpieces to touching this garish Hollywood trash?The only reason this review gets 1 extra star is because the soundtrack & scenery was pretty good.
I liked it, my friends liked it, we like to watch it together, boo hoo u dont like dont watch it simple as that!

reviews.review_title: Just no where near as good as the series....
reviews.content:
The acting false and awkward, like they were complete strangers to each other. Waxy, wooden jokes and just a BAD dialogue.
The alleged life ""problems"".... God, it's sooo
hard in a millionaires lifestyle, it really is??!
Charlotte who never works, has hired help as well as Miranda, really don't understand how that compares to actual working mum's who already struggle.
Love how Miranda just quits her job and gets a head hunter straight after..... She must have thousands of dollars in savings.... Carrie just "freelancing" and Samantha "working" on Times Square, thanks to Smith.
God... Then the super, super luxurious trip to Abu Dhabi, all expenses paid of course.... What else? Coach!!? Not these girls.... God it's beneath them. Because they're working mum's except for Samantha abd Carrie who still think they're in their 30s...or in her 20's.....
Urrrchhhh..... You just feel their pain don't you?
Then home they are back to their perfect lives... Allegedly.
Oh let's not forget one more thing... Carrie thinking There's a future with Aidan when she goes back 15/20 years in time forgetting he's happily married with three boys and so is Carrie who's been chasing after Big every other series episode.

I have seen every SATC episode from HBO as well as the first movie...and have to say I really thought this 2nd movie had more to offer and was well done, was funny and entertaining. The outfits where wonderful, the 4 girls always looked great! It was a movie to just go to and laugh along with the girls, feel emotional at times and relate to motherhood with Charlotte and Miranda. This is a feel good movie that was good from beginning to end.. its worth seeing!! I loved it and can not wait to see over and over again. Not sure why this review is requiring to write 10 full lines..I think this is the reason why there are not more positive review..so for that I feel bad for the previous reviews .

What happened to this series?It was a great show but now they are just milking it. The dialogs was horrible. Who ever says things like that? Lawrence of my labia?! The acting was bad too. The characters were believable before but now. Urgh. Every time they were talking it feels like it was "forced". The sound track however is commendable. I don't why they went "ballsy" on us and tried something different in the movie. Fans want to see this because they get a sense of nostalgia in it. Doing something different destroys that.If you liked the show in anyway STAY away from this film. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!Watch the entire series on DVD and watch the first movie. BUT PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS ONE! I think Marmaduke will be better than this.

reviews.review_title: Sex and The City 2 Rocked. Get Over It!
reviews.content: The girls are back!!! If you want to know what went around in the show, check out the TV show trivia and if you need to remember what went on in the first movie, visit Sex and The City The Movie Now, the second film: Carrie (Sarah Jessica Parker) and Big (Chris Noth) are about to celebrate their wedding anniversary. Charlotte (Kristin Davis) has always gotten the family she wanted-she has two beautiful daughters and she is happy with her husband Harry (Evan Handler). Miranda (Cynthia Nixon) and Steve (David Eigenberg) are back and happy together. Samantha (Kim Catrall) iswell Samantha. Of course things are not as smooth as they first might seem: Carrie is afraid Big is getting too comfortable in their marriage. She starts to freak out that they will turn into a boring old married couple. After all, Big is too fond of watching TV, ordering and staying in. She is now working on her new book and this time it is about marriage. Samantha is over 50 and she is dealing with the side-effects of menopause in a very Samantha way: taking as many pills as she can so that she can "trick her body into thinking it is younger" and it seems to be working. Her libido is back and her hot flushes are under control. She is in fact the happiest of the bunch. Miranda and Steve are great as a couple but Miranda's now asshole of a colleague is giving her nightmares. For the first time in her life, Miranda is dreading her office and hating her job. It doesn't seem worth the trouble that she is missing out on all of her son Brady's important moments. Charlotte is about to have a nervous breakdown. Her baby won't stop crying. In fact she is so relentless and loud, she could have been a perfect commercial for promoting birth control. And despite being a mild child, her oldest Lily is sick of all the attention Rose is getting. Thankfully, her nanny (Alice Eve) is a god-sent, She is sweet, lovely and really great with the kids. But one problem: She is a young, pretty blonde with big breasts. And she doesn't wear bras. So when Samantha meets her ex Smith's (Jason Lewis) movie producer, a very rich man from Abu Dhabi and the gets a job offer, the girls are presented with the chance to an all expenses paid vacation. They will have a chance to get away from it all and there will be 4 of them- without the kids and the men. Just what they all needed. However, how smart is it really for Samantha to be in a Muslim city where most of the population doesn't consist of modern, new generation Muslims but old-fashioned, ultra-traditional and conventional people? Where women mostly cover all of their bodies and hair and so do men? It gets much worse when she meets an attractive Danish architect (Max Ryan) and wellwants to do him. But the greatest yet the worst thing happens to Carrie when he runs into Aidan (John Corbett), the second love of her life. The guy she almost married Are they truly over each other? Will it be a reunion for "two old friends" or is she actually playing with fire as Charlotte suggested?The review for the show, the first movie and more analyzing on the first movie is on pinartarhan.com/blog

After loving the first one, I got this movie and I was very leery as everyone said it sucked. While it had several very bad moments (Liza Minelli and karaoke singing among them) and several bad jokes, I was actually pleasantly surprised at the fact that it was a very sweet story. While more along the lines of the "caliber" of the TV show than the first, and it was WAY too long, it delivered a nice story. I thought a good half hour could've been cut easily. What was remarkable was how the 4 of them aged in just 2 or 3 years. I particularly like the scene with the Arab women, which is something that really exists. I thought the movie tried to address real issues, especially with motherhood, but we are starkly reminded that these are 4 rich women and while all people have problems, if it weren't for the fact that we "care" about them, the movie would've been a portrayal of the ridiculously decadent.

I'm not complaining or prudish about the nudity but rather it's such a guy movie move. Charlotte's break down is actually a pretty good dramatic moment. Carrie is a bit whiny in her 'problem'. Samantha is over-the-top and has some ridiculous fun. Then the movie goes to.

I've been the fan of the original show for years but this chic-flick is the biggest disappointment ever. Pointless fluff, completely absurd, sarcastic humor, negative perceptions of the Middle East, racism etc etc.. The way this movie treats Islamic culture is profoundly offensive.It is also frustrating when you're watching these type of movies only to discover that the movie was nearly over, and there would be no chance for redemption.P.S It was quite scary to see Sarah Jessica Parker on a big screen, would've been wise if she was in Burqa for the entire movie.This movie is not worth rating!

reviews.review_title: Oh the horror!! Not worth watching on cable!
reviews.content: So bad I literally can't get through it. Having recently been to the middle east - I can't express how appalling the obvious and not really funny jokes and observations they put out there. I'm hoping it didn't go far internationally as it's truly embarrassing to Amercans.What the heck happened? From costuming to makeup this movie was beyond "off." Did the directors and producers suffer brain damage that made them approve the dailies for this piece of crap?Everyone looks old tired and uncomfortable. Way older than they are by the way. Dressed ridiculously for anywhere - much less a trip to the middle east. Aiden was the only one that looked like he was traveling on earth. The rest were fashion victims of several IDIOT stylists. The plot was actually worse than a combination of clichés from the smart series. From an over the top gay wedding to Samantha conning some Emir into a lavish trip. It's not fun even if you watch to ridicule it. Several drinks might not even help.Here I sit - painfully watching this train wreck on HBO - apparently with a horrible karaoke scene coming up. One gets the sense that every member of the cast realized what a dog it was and barely acted. I guess every actor needs to round out their accolades with a razzie or two huh? Hope they cashed in on this one as I'd bet their phones stopped ringing the minute this came out.There's two and a half hours of my life I'll never get back...Save yourself! Don't even bother to watch it.(And that's the reason I bothered to type this review.)FYI - I did manage to get to the end of this horror completely sober. However tempted I was to get stone drunk to see if it would get the bad taste out of my mouth. It wouldn't have helped anyway...My final conclusion: The producers became so tired of this concession that they murdered it. How do you KNOW there will be NO SATC3? By charging admission to this insulting garbage. And I mean insulting to every stripe of viewer, fans, the subject matter, the location and the poor actors. Don't worry. No one will be asking about another SATC movie. While I'm personally neither here nor there about Kim Catrall, SATC2 gets the prize for giving an actress the worst stereotypical "unlikeable and stupid slut" role I've ever seen on film. I was actually embarrassed for Catrall in the second half. The directors and writers get the "Idiot" for thinking it could play as campy. If we're lucky, we never have to see any of their work again in our lifetimes. Yech!

reviews.review_title: I wasted two hours of my life.
reviews.content: This movie was a shear disappointment to me. I absolutely loved the series to no end, and the first movie was mildly enjoyable but not as good as the series. This movie was overkill, a series and one movie was entirely enough. The jokes were not even mildly funny in any way. The problems these women face in this movie don't even entail sex, nor is the setting in the usual New York City. The actions of Samantha, though true to her nature are still disrespectful to the culture of the nation the girls visit. Charlotte is jobless, has a nanny (and probably a housekeeper) to take care of everything, and still is stressed about not having any time of her own. Miranda, doesn't hardly act like her normal character in the show. Carrie is essentially complaining about having what she strives so hard to get in the series, love and marriage with Mr. Big. The issues the girls are having are not even worthy of being called real issues, there is not any true sex or the city. All it really is, is lets bitch and complain while we go to Arabia! Suggest new title should be "Sexless and Cityless".
Disrespectful to the Muslim culture and totally missed the mark. No action. It's a teenage movie and a total disrespect to a former SATC fan.

I have watched all the series and loved them, it was outstanding.but really? this movie has nothing do with sex and the city.why is Carrie nagging Big so much? leave him alone he just wants to watch TV in bed? its like they were looking for something to argue about with them, but really its been too many arguments so just leave them alone.half the movie was oh look at the size of the room we are staying in, with are own personal people, i just don't understand how any of that mattered? god. I really wanted to like it, i did but it just wasn't what i thought it was going to be.sorry guys, don't go see it, SATC wont be the same :(

reviews.review_title: he movie would be enjoyable if I was a 16 year old stuck in a body of a 50 year old woman..
reviews.content: I have been the fan of the original show for years. Unfortunately, I have to say that "Sex and the city 2" was more than disappointing.. In this film ironic and even sarcastic humor that distinguished the show from the others is gone...The show just got so old that humor vanished along with Samantha's estrogen.. The characters are dull, the story line is boring and some of the scenes are just stretched.. In my opinion - the movie would be enjoyable if I was a 16 year old stuck in a body of a 50 year old woman.. Producers should have left the legend of "Sex and the city" be. Instead of completing the show this movie leaves a bad taste in your mouth. The main character Carrie not only got old from the outside, she got rotten from the inside as well - instead of living happily ever after she still focuses on the small things making an elephant out of the small marital problems. Since she obviously is not happy and not even young and beautiful, the producers decide to go back to one of the old story lines - Carrie meets her old love in the middle of the Middle East. Not only is this storyline unreal, but it is unnecessary as well.. The character Samanta..well lets just say that free spirited femme fatale was the FATAL error in this movie. Not only was she boring, her sex scene in this movie was just one close up away from the actual porn movie.. To conclude, I have to say, that if it wasn't for Miranda and Charlotte - the movie would have been a complete waste of time. I was really happy to see that at least two of the original four characters moved on with their life - found new purpose and new topics and the old wounds were not brought up. All and all the movie was disappointing..I will never like "Sex and the city" again..

Stick to the first movie and the stick with the SATC Shows.Its boring, has no meaning.. Your better off waiting for it to come out on DVD People that like it are the people who have hopped on the Bandwagon and all of a sudden love this show or should i say Movie half the people who watch the new movie have no clue who half the characters are.I think the Producers knew the movie wasn't up to stranded as the first one but knew people will come out and watch it. an he was right, Cinemas everywhere where booked and you couldn't find a seat. They made a lot of money from this movie so if maybe a refund wouldn't hurt

An absolute turkey of a film, probably one of the worst cinematic experiences I've ever had. So disappointed that the cast and Michael Patrick King thought fit to release this load of rubbish onto the public. No real plot line or substance to it, sex and the city 2 is just a glorified fashion show without any redeeming qualities and portrays the four girls as vapid, grasping, spoilt idiots. Miranda in particular seems to have underwent a complete personality transplant and has been turned into some yodelling party girl who constantly feels the need to translate every word whilst they are abroad. An absolute travesty of a film,am going to have to watch a lot of re-runs of this show to remind me of when it used to be good.

reviews.review_title: No city and also no sex??
reviews.content: How can you make a movie called Sex and the City 2 when it takes place in Abu Dhabi and no one has intercourse, 2 and 1/2 hours of simply terrible film making

reviews.review_title: Cliché and emptiness: packaged in a box too big for its contents
reviews.content: Even as a fan of the HBO series and the first movie, I couldn't get past the sloppy dialogue, rampant cliché (even for SATC standards), and frustrating predictability of this truly amateurish and asinine film. I don't call the flick asinine because of its characters or content (some level of laughable drama and superficiality is to be expected) but rather because the sheer unimaginativeness of it all: the drab, been-there-before lines, and most of all, the truly embarrassing West Meets Middle East triteness. It was as if a freshman producer had googled "things that can go wrong when 40-something neophytes visit Abu Dhabi" and then churned out a film based on the search results. I won't provide spoilers, but suffice it to say that Murphy's Law of traveling chic New Yorkers in the UAE holds true--but would you really expect anything different? Most frustrating was the film's length: a good hour longer than it ought to be, the film begins in earnest with a wedding scene that accomplishes nothing in terms of dramatic effect, but takes a great deal of time to trudge through. The viewer feels like he has eaten enough appetizers to fill him up that he doesn't even want to see -- let alone eat -- the course that comes next. Indeed, the film's structure feels so unbalanced and ambitious that even the most devout fan of SATC is eager to hear Parker's hideously sentimental (and oddly expositorial) closing line come, just as a sign that the torture is over.There is one admirable scene between Davis and Nixon on the challenge of motherhood and career balance, and "Mr. Big" delivers a respectable performance. But otherwise, save this afterthought of a movie for a Tuesday night $1 rental over some cheap wine. That's about all it's worth.

reviews.review_title: Strictly eye candy; all sweet, no substance.
reviews.content: I did enjoy the clothes, even the awful ones, but that's it. I don't think I've ever seen such gluttonous extravagance put to film. All the 1st class, one car/butler for every gal, desert excursion complete with clothes, camels and food.....not only unrealistic, but not even something you'd fantasize about. Then they plunk Aiden down in the middle east to make it even more unbelievable. I don't need to elaborate on what the other reviews say about being culturally insensitive. Whose idea was it to have them go to the middle east? Just tragic.

The series was great and the first film was a perfect ending to the story. This film however, is racist and sexist and portrays the women as shallow, selfish, vacuous, offensive, ignorant and astonishingly lacking in self-awareness. The characters always had heart but now they just have a massive sense of self-entitlement, and it's ugly. Whoever wrote and approved this script should be ashamed of themselves. Plus, it's full of glaringly obvious product-placement. The only bit that's any good is when Raj from Spooks pops up. Other than that, all I can say is go and watch something else that won't make you hate characters you love and eventually yourself for putting up with it.

Slow on the timing.... The first show was quick and sharp, 2nd would be better if they sped up the dialogue. I felt like I was hanging in the air between the punch lines. Love all of the characters, and the storyline, just pick up the tempo.

Why would you rate it so low? This movie is so accurate of all the things you go with your love one. And the luxurious life of middle East, everything is so true. It looks superficial, but it is very truthful.

reviews.review_title: Dr. Bad-Movie or: How I Stopped Watching This Movie And Find A Better One
reviews.content: I assume this is a bad movie. Haven't seen it though, so I'll check it out and then I'll write another review!

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I've seen in years....and I've seen A LOT of movies...
reviews.content: I am fully convinced that the summary of the review says it all.anyway other than the fact that it was an extremely boring movie (and I am a patient person)I really hoped that somewhere along the 2:20 hours way thing would definitely improve. oh how wrong I was...the scene that crash and burned to the ground my expectations was when the Arab women unveiled their "new spring collection" outfits. HORRIFYING, IDIOTIC, PATHETIC AND OFF ANY CHART.I would have been happier watching bugs bunny chasing jerry on the moon in circles.so go sleep for 2:20hours, it's a bigger investment of your time.

reviews.review_title: Not the best film I have ever seen, but still it was good
reviews.content: I went to see this film with my three girlfriends. We watched the first film together and we thought it was great, so we looked forward to watching the sequel. First of all, I would like to emphasize that there was a promotion and the ticket was not expensive. We didn't pay a lot of money and we didn't watch something that was worth a lot of money. I can't say that I was disappointed by the second film. It has its funny moments, but it lacks a strong story line. The first film had a better plot. But what I can say for sure is that Samantha's behavior was hilarious, she was great. You can laugh your head off. Also, I liked the stunning views from Abu Dabi. They were great and you can really have an idea about the country and its traditions by watching this film. To conclude, I can say that Sex and the City 2 won't be the hit of the year, but it works for killing time.

reviews.review_title: Tagline for this movie should be: Shopping and stuff like that are Cool, but Charity and hungry people across the world aren't
reviews.content: So what, basically this movie tells us that shoes, money, glamor and everything else like that really matters in this world? I hate when Hollywood uses a lot of their money to create some kind of a fake feeling in people that this is like a big movie hit that you must not miss it. Or something like, every friend will think you are a loser if you haven't seen this move yet. In my opinion this movie has no big story for my soul. Everything that teaches me is that money (and everything connected with it) is the most important thing. I think that the only thing this movie teaches me that movies like this can make some people really dumb. There is a danger that some girl will take this chick for their role models and became as stupid as this girl look on the cover.I think Hollywood should spend more money on commercializing good movies, that people must see, not to save horrible movies like this.And one question remains? Were there any money involved from wealthy Sheikh to promote Dubai and Abu Dhabi? I have heard some news that things aren't going so well as they planned. Is this some kind of commercial?

reviews.review_title: Appalling, embarrassing stereotype of both US and Arab Culture
reviews.content: Didn't anyone have any doubts when they read the script? Four rich, spoiled, white American girls behaving appallingly in a stereotype version of Abu Dhabi - "the Arab world". Cringe. I'm not sure why I watched it all, I was on a plane and could've changed to something more worthwhile, but I was transfixed.The only surprise was that it could get worse than when it opened with the 4 women whining about imaginary difficulties in their lives: (1) There is something wrong with poor Carrie's marriage because her and Big don't feel and behave in exactly the same way as when they first met. (2) Poor Charlotte who doesn't appear to work has a beautiful nanny. (3) Miranda has the only thing that could be considered a real problem, a misogynist boss. Cured by throwing a hissy fit and giving up the job without any real fight. (4) Sorry, can't remember what "problem" Samantha had.But wait until they start heading to "The Arab World". Then it really spirals downhill becoming not only trite but just so uncomfortable. This should be required viewing for any terrorist faction wanting to stir up hatred for America or white women in general: This is what Americans are, this is what they think of us. Unfortunately it has to be seen to be believed. Really the cast should have turned up for their Razzie award. Come on guys, show some remorse.

This movie is very weak. The title is Sex and the City. New York is one of the main characters and it is missing in action. The addition of Abu Dhabi must have been some type of product placement decision, as it made no sense- other products were rampant. This may have killed the franchise. The girls are getting a little long in the tooth and the lighting was not very flattering. Mr. Big was at his best...Charlotte was played perfectly....Miranda was sexy as usual....Carrie was too biatchy for me. Samantha didn't do it for me...sorry. I would not even recommend that you watch it on HBO....it is a waste of time....I was a huge fan of the series....Maybe this is why there is not Soprano's movie....

This film totally lived up to expectations!! i laughed all the way through!it is everything that SATC is and more!! I'm going to see it again!i love the laughs, the fashion, the crazy situations they get themselves into. And the shoes!! there are some surprises throughout the film. if only i was 20 again i would have loved to go and live in new york!The bad reviews are totally unjustified.I really hope they make a third film!

reviews.review_title: Not Great... but not bad either
reviews.content: So after reading plenty of reviews on the movie, my mom and I still decided we had to see it for ourselves,despite most reviews being negative. Being a SATC fan through and through the trailers definitely peeked my attention but I was a bit disappointed to find that most of the "OMG" factors had been given away in the trailers. Taking the girls out of NYC was not a great idea and didn't help the story line once so ever. It had its funny moments, it had its dragged out moments and it had the same old SATC moments. It was definitely NOT as good as the 1st movie, but it is still worth going to see. I hope for SATC's sake they do not go forward with #3.. there is only 1 thing left they can do with Carrie, and it was ruled out in the 2nd movie. Do not discourage from bad reviews, see for yourself. I enjoyed it, more or less.

reviews.review_title: Watchable But It Should Not Be Canon
reviews.content:
Sex and the City was a great film so what happened in Sex and the City 2?*Spoilers*
This film is not true to Carrie, Aiden, nor Samantha. It is for Miranda and Charlotte though.The first part of the film feels more Sex and the City than the latter (when they go to the middle east).Charlotte's worry over the nanny is realistic and when her and Miranda have a 1 on 1 at the bar it felt very real and true for friends to talk deeply about their lives concerning motherhood.Samantha is over sexualized (yes this happened). Going to the middle east was a vacation but it was also business for Samantha so her behavior there was out of character. She would NEVER jeopardize work with her sexual temptations. She knew how to separate work and sex like a professional but she is wanting sex so much that she uses sexual innuendos so much in an unprofessional manner with her business colleagues that it is cringy (especially since her sex drive is very low anyway). It was disappointing to see Samantha as unlikable. The only good parts with Samantha is towards the end right after Carrie and Aiden had dinner. Perfect Samantha you're back!Carrie's problem with Big is so childish it's very unrealistic. She worried so much about Big's feelings after the incident in the first film that she threw it out the window when they're married.Here is where she meets up with Aiden (which what are the odds) in the middle east and his character is so cringy and disgusting I think they forgot that Aiden was loyal to his wife, has kids, and is happily married. This Aiden is like a dark twisted version of him that I cannot even grasp. He was the good guy in the series, the perfect guy, the romantic... now he is a creep who breaks vows. I just don't think this Aiden is real and Carrie's behavior with him is appalling. From what we see with her and Big I had no idea she hated their coupling so much she'd do that to him...It's a terrible plot for Carrie and Big to add that into the mixture and personally it feels unrealistic that they'd even get back together afterwards. Carrie in this film is basically where "once a cheater always a cheater" comes from. If I were Big I'd run but because Big is so in love with her (who knows why) he decides to give her s ring to 'remind' her that she's taken.When Carrie asks why the diamond is black I laughed when she thought it was because of her soul. I was disappointed when Big said it was because she was unique but we all know it's because of her soul.Even Carrie is self aware that she is a bad wife and a nag with a black soul. That's the only accurate thing in this film. It's only watchable for Charlotte and Miranda.Carrie is such a bad friend in this film she went back to a crappy character. She uses Samantha to get her into a premiere Big doesn't even want to go to and she tells Charlotte in a mean way she's crazy. Miranda's actions and behavior in the film is what saves it. She's fun, happy, true to her character and has even learned that telling Carrie she's being stupid won't stop her from doing stupid things as Charlotte takes on that role. It was a vacation for Miranda and she deserved it.

1. Charlotte cant handle motherhood with maids, full time nanny and a millionaire husband 2. Carrie's selfish single lifestyle attitude towards her marriage to big 3. Samantha fu*ks anything has a pause 4. Marinade has pretty much no character in the plot ++ 5. there is no plot6. the fashion is good but do they really need Christina Dior to ride a camel and couture for UAE market? 7. thought they all millionaires (with all the clothes and shoes they are wearing ) cant afford 5500 each /night hotel or just move to a normal room for a night instead of catching a crappy taxi running out of the country? 8. what does the guy couple do once again? robbing banks? with a wedding like that they must be! ....... too many to conclude...too little time as i have already wasted 2.5 hrs of my life the most important one there is no fa*king 'city' ! why don't you just call the movie 'sex in middle east'? 'menopause'? ?how the mighty fall?

reviews.review_title: Not as bad I was expecting, given the reviews here and elsewhere
reviews.content: Yes, I read the reviews, both in multiple papers and on here. Yes, I went anyway.Thoughts? I am more bothered by the plot holes than any of the other hot topics oft-discussed here, e.g. it taking place largely in Abu Dhabi, the AbFab-approaching ridiculousness of some of the costumes (Carrie in the J'adore Dior outfit meeting Aiden in the souk market tops it). So, let's see: it's been two years since the end of SATC1, which ended with Charlotte discovering she's pregnant, but somehow she skipped the whole nine-months pregnancy thing and spurted out a kid who's already a "terrible twos" toddler. Stanford and Anthony, two basically upper-middle-class Manhattanites, hire Liza to not only officiate but sing at their wedding. Bitch, please: Liza's pricetag for such an endeavor would eclipse the $1 million Elton John got for doing Rush Limbaugh's reception, and there is no freakin' way they'd have the dough for that.Abu Dhabi? Their trip there is at first described as the "month to go before temperatures meet melting." Then a clock in Big's apartment indicates that it's August, meaning that that month expired four months ago (everything else in the film, however, implies that the film takes place in spring 2010). Then Samantha says it's 118 degrees as they're headed to the airport. Really, WTF? A huge chunk of the last film was about Big buying Carrie the Fifth Avenue penthouse of their dreams, replete with epic shoe closet ... which they apparently immediately replace with a small-ish apartment on a lower floor. I can only assume the writers did this as a concession to the economy, but the plot flaw here is that while Carrie never sold her UES apartment because the market was bad, apparently they had no problems selling the penthouse. The priciest real estate in the city, in the city's worst economic crisis in 75 years. Uh-huhhhhhh.Concurred that this film had largely no plot and that it was ridiculous for Carrie to randomly encounter Aiden in an Abu Dhabi souk. (Realistically, a rug shopper would not be going to the UAE for bargains.) There was WAY too much quasi-women empowerment stuff, from the "I Am Woman" scene at the karaoke place to Charlotte and Miranda hashing it out that they're "bad mothers" because they realize that child-rearing many times sucks, even given their extremely privileged positions as women who are lawyers and wife-of lawyers who can afford full-time nanny care. I did think the UAE, even if it's the most liberal of Arab cultures, deserved its much needed digs at women's continued subservience in such nations, and I am imagine the producers added it after they were denied permission to film in Dubai, solely out of fear that SATC was not "morally acceptable" under UAE doctrine.The biggest problem the film had, however, was a lack of resolution of the Carrie/Big baby matter, which I can only assume was done to save a plot for the now-not-likely SATC3 movie. Plot-wise and logically, the thing missing from Big and Carrie's marriage was not just a diamond ring, but a baby, and considering SJP had a surrogate harvesting her two twins during filming, I am amazed this did not come up.

reviews.review_title: Sex And The Cringing With Embarrassment
reviews.content: One star for each of our beloved original series characters! What is the matter with angry Director/Writer Michael Patrick King? Was this movie his hidden political statement? How did Executive Producer Sarah Jessica Parker ever let some scenes in this movie roll? The Trailers were fantastic, fabulous, and fun. What happened? Best magnum jam soundtrack I have ever heard! Even if you never see the movie, buy the soundtrack. It is eclectic, uplifting and rapturous! The cinematography is old world opulent, breathtaking and luxurious.Patricia Fields' fashion is, as per usual, creatively unusual. Her use of color is as rich as any Middle Eastern Sheikh. Her fashion is flirty, flattering, and floating on top of the sand. The vintage Halston is yummy. The shoes...the shoes...the shoes...out of this world heavenly. As we say out in the country: Good Fashion!Who cares about the plot that is not. We're there with the gals to get out of the house, not cook and have a cocktail. We are also there to see our beloved fabulous foursome have adventures in New York and abroad!The wedding was vintage Hollywood right out of a movie set in the 1930's. We also love Liza!! She is woman of a certain age up there on stage singing and dancing like she is 30! What a pro. She sang on the soundtrack more than once...where did she go? Then, poof. The wedding was gone. Did they throw the bouquet? Where were all the potentially funny things that happen at weddings and make them endearing and memorable to all?Enough moping around New York, get to Abu Dahbi already!The first 2-3 menopause jokes were funny, but then it just got old. Post menopausal. Move on. Then some of our beloved girls got mean. Mean girls, not just little spats between 20 year friends, mean. What?Then down the sand dunes we went. The stereo-typical story of the ethnocentric "Ugly American" who does not care to understand other cultures because the rest of the world is supposed to be just like America. Thank you very little Michael Patrick King, we working gals who travel overseas have enough trouble being Americans without bad blockbuster help.The packed audience went from tingling with excitement to cringing with embarrassment for our country and our manners. We know better. Why did Samantha, of all characters; a successful, smart, shrewd, seasoned business professional, miss her manners and mess up the biggest client she has most likely ever had or will have in her career? I mean, what is the big menopausal problem? Put on a light linen jacket and a pair of light linen long pants in public and get a room. Sometimes, menopausal women may loose a modicum of their minds, but not all their manners! SATC3 would be welcome if it will be light and happy. SATC2 was not terribly funny or sexy, just verging on shrinkingly terrible.Katherine Barrett Baker, Director of the Sabot School of Etiquette, Manakin-Sabot, VA, www.betteretiquette.blogspot.com

Simply there is nothing in the movie except of scenes with boobs and saying the F word from time ti time. No plot, no idea, boring for 99% of the time. I do wonder how it can have 4 on the scale... I guess the series lovers put high scores on it. If you want to know the biggest "idea" from the movie without watching it, there you go : "Do or do not people have to spend all the time together after marriage or can they meet other people and spend the time on their own?". The answers however You have to figure out for yourself, not going to happen simply while watching this movie. Please have a walk or so instead of an idea of borrowing and watching this piece of ....

The only scene that remotely resembled the original show was between Charlotte and Miranda being honest and vulnerable about how difficult motherhood was. That made me tear up. Outside of that, this entire movie is a dumpster pile of trash.

reviews.review_title: Oh my God...worst movie of the year, easily!!
reviews.content: I had no idea it was going to be THIS bad! Can't believe some reviewers actually give it a 5 out of 10. They must have either watched a different movie or be blind and deaf!!! What utter, utter rubbish this was - how could this happen?? I LOVE the TV series, and I kinda liked the first movie, but this!!! Utter drivel...bad acting, bad plot, HORRIBLE outfits - you name it!!Don't watch is my recommendation!! IMDb is forcing me to write more lines before they'll publish; don't really know what else to say - seems like I've already wasted too much of my time on this!! This should definitely get the Rasberry award thingy, not just because this was a shitty movie, but also because should have been good - you know, some movies are bound to be rubbish (action movies, mostly, I guess), but this was based on a great story. Guess they shouldn't have made a second movie...Am I ready now?? Can I go now, please??
I really don't get the bad reviews here I loved this movie :) it was fun, entertaining and loved the Middle East scenes!

It's a known fact that the sequel to any movie is never as great as the original, but after watching the first movie (which I thought was pretty decent for being based on a TV show) I was really eager to see the second one. However, my doubts about this movie kicked in within the first 10 minutes, starting with the surprising (and awkward) cameo of Liza Minelli dancing (and even more awkwardly singing) to Single Ladies. After that, every scene seemed to be one face palm after the other between the cheesy humor and dramatic story lines. In fact, one of the things that I think dimmed this movie's spark was the outrageously unrealistic situations in which each of the characters were put in - like Miranda quitting her privileged (and cushy) job as a lawyer to become a full time stay at home mom -.- And did I mention how ungrateful they were this in movie? I mean Big gets Carrie a turnable flat-screened TV for their anniversary and she's pouty because it's not jewelry. Another irritating characteristic - the fact that every single character in the movie had an irritating trait. Want me to list them? OK: Carrie was being a whiny little baby about everything Big did, Miranda became a walking travel guide/manual/dictionary , Charlotte took stupidity to another level, and Samantha only spoke in one-liners. I mean, it is hard to like a movie when you can't even stomach the four main characters.Long story short, the movie had it's thrillers and shocks but the outcomes tended to provoke audiences into a yawn or a frustrated rolling of the eyes. But I will give it to each woman in the movie...they looked fabulous, and the movie as a whole made me appreciate the joys of female life. And maybe - just maybe, I can grow up to be like one of them....rich, sexy, with 3 best girl friends - and still having drama.

reviews.review_title: Sad to say, but I was very disappointed.
reviews.content: I started watching the show on demand with my sister shortly before the first movie came out. I absolutely fell in love with the show and ended up buying the entire series on DVD. I also enjoyed the first movie - it kept the tone of the show and the characters maintained their personalities, etc.I was so disappointed by the 2nd movie. -There was barely a plot. After two hours in the theater, I only remember one significant thing happening. -The characters were not themselves. Carrie made one pun that I can remember, Charlotte was so weak and unhappy through the whole thing, and Miranda was way too excited and happy about everything (I missed the realist/cynic). Samantha was the only one who got to maintain part of her personality, and even that was weaker than on the show. -Too many celebrity cameos that didn't really contribute to the story -Too much pandering to the audience. It was all about saying things that would make women cheer in the theater. It's hard to raise a child *cheers* Men don't like women to speak because they are afraid of strong women *cheers* let's all sing "I am woman" *cheers* -Too many things happened that had no explanation and weren't built upon. (EX: When did Stanford and Anthony start dating?) -Where was everyone else? I think Miranda and Charlotte's husbands each had one line. Magda made a few faces. They focused completely on the 4 ladies and Big, but there still wasn't really a story.Overall, it just made me sad to see how much potential the movie had (why didn't they show more of the 80s? etc.). It just wasn't the Sex and the City that I came to love! I don't think I will even buy it when it comes out on DVD.

reviews.review_title: Give Us A Third Movie And Improved Sequel
reviews.content: I too have seen every episode and both movies numerous times. Many people were displeased with the first movie, even though it was pretty good for the most part in my opinion. However, it could have been improved upon. But practically everyone was displeased with the second movie. The plot was weak, and the bulk of the movie was in a foreign country. The ads always declare that New York is the fifth character, and she was absent from most of it. Also, they finally bring Aiden back, and then they didn't do nearly enough with that character. Now because of this poor sequel everyone says that Sex is over and there should not be a third movie. It's not that our interest is gone. The problem is that the storyline needs to be much improved. We still want to see our gals in a third movie. We just want it to be interesting and dramatic. We need more than exotic locations and glamorous outfits. Michael Patrick King please contact me as I have an excellent idea for a sequel. We want our gals to go out with a bang and not a whimper. They entertained us for several years and they deserve to be remembered well.

reviews.review_title: Look, it really wasn't that bad...
reviews.content: Last night a few of my girlfriends and I went to go see Sex and the City 2, with pretty much the lowest expectations you can have - the reviews have ALL been bad, but regardless we felt we wanted to see it for ourselves.And you know what? I'm glad we did. Because really, it wasn't that bad.Sure, there are some cringe worthy moments (Liza Minnelli singing Beyonce, the karaoke scene, and the oh so horrid "Lawrence of my Labia" remark), but otherwise there were funny Carrie one liners, gorgeous fashion, good looking men and of course, the hilarious Samantha. The entire cinema seemed to enjoy it, and there were times where we couldn't stop laughing because it was so hilarious! On the downside, the girls just don't have a good grasp on reality... Carrie and Big's marriage is just so unrealistic it's not funny (who eats out EVERY SINGLE NIGHT?!). Plus their moaning about not making first class somewhat annoyed me, as did Big giving Carrie the ring at the end (C'mon, she blew it, why give her JEWELLERY?!) You do have to remember though that it's JUST A MOVIE, and not to take it too seriously.At the end of the day, it's definitely not a 10/10, but I think it deserved a 6 at least. I think what people need to realise is that it's been years since the TV series, and the girls are now older and pretty much all settled down with kids. It was a pleasure to watch them, but I think they should leave it there. SATC 3 would be pushing it in my opinion.Go see it for yourself, don't take it too seriously and make up your own mind. I enjoyed it, you may do too.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies ever.
reviews.content: I love SATC series and still watch reruns.The first movie was OK I guess. It was not that great but hey Carrie and Big got married. And it did have some plot.This one though, is so bad, it left me cringing throughout the movie. No plot. And oh my god, enough about the HORMONES!!!! Sarah, Kim, Cynthia and Kristin should be ashamed of themselves for even contributing to this joke of a film. But I guess they are like the characters, uber rich and vain women. Not the intelligent SATC women we used to love.Disgusted!

I was a SATC fan since the beginning, couldn:t wait for the new seasons and episodes.Then it was over, the girls said goodbye. Years later came out the movie sequel, which was ok. But this one is just bad. It's not funny but ridiculous.They clishes like the gay weddig, Samantha had sex on the wedding a much younger guy.. it was funny in the 90's but not anymore in 2010's.It's not a waste of time movie, but there was enough to watch once. Thanks, but no.I only gave 5 stars because of the past of this franchise.

reviews.review_title: Not the Best Movie but not the worst!
reviews.content: I think a lot of people are reading into this movie a bit much, I don't know what people were expecting,I walked into this movie knowing that it was simply going to be a entertaining movie nothing less nothing more,I don't really see much of a difference between the series and the movies its just in the movies everything is cramped into 2 hrs instead of a bunch of episodes,so they whine and complain a lot over nothing who cares,its not like other people don't whine and complain,I am actually glad they whine and complain while they live such lavish lifestyles its just means that there human,so while this movie might not have the best plot and while the characters can act a bit self absorbed ,its still a fun entertaining movie never less, so if you want to watch a deep thought provoking movie then this isn't for you, but if you just want to have a few laughs with some friends or loved ones and to not have to think about anything then give it a try its really not as bad as everyone makes it seem.

Riding the popularity of the 2008 movie, 'Sex And The City 2' boldly dares to continue a story that was well and truly ended twice. The first full-length feature justified its existence with the genuinely plausible next phase of Carrie and company's lives; the sequel, bravely, came forward with the tried and tested adage that girls just really want have to fun. Where its predecessor was an often sombre affair, number two revels in enough hedonism to make up for the previous lack of it.Finally and happily married, Carrie has settled in to her life with Mr. Big as her friends have to their own commitments; Miranda and Charlotte have also settled into their unions, while Samantha is finally serving herself alone, just how she likes it. This is the sequel's main stumbling block, that the characters have faced nearly every relationship ache imaginable. Therefore, their individual conflicts they face in 'Sex And The City 2' - heavy chested nannies and irritating bosses - are so trivial that the unfolding drama sadly reverts the characters into exaggerated caricatures of their former selves.Courageously switching the main location from New York City to the Middle Eastern culture of Abu Dhabi, the film is similar to several episodes from the show that staged the girl's exploits elsewhere; New York City, however, was a major character in itself, one that isn't easily replaced by a holiday destination that offers endless opportunities for escapades which sadly, hardly ever occur.There is still plenty of heart and emotion, but long term fans unfortunately begin to feel like they can't root for their favourite characters anymore, as they are written in a manner that actually portrays them in the negative light that critics have long ascribed to them. Clashing their New York sass against the culture of the Middle East is a clever, though often uncomfortable concept as the film tackles racism like no other franchise - forever considering equal opportunities - could.There is much to enjoy about 'Sex And The City 2', such as its intricate wardrobe and lavish setting; when the most positive aspects of the movie are aesthetics, however, it is hard not to realise that the sequel is a somewhat vacant affair. It does contrast the heavy tone of the first movie well, making it an excellent companion piece, though with such shallow character conflicts, it tarnishes the resolution and conclusion of the 2008 feature. Therefore, audiences are left itching for a third and final film not to satisfy their lust for more 'Sex And The City', but to regain a sense of closure.

reviews.review_title: A disgrace to the SATC franchise!
reviews.content: The only thing good about this movie were the beautiful costumes/outfits. Otherwise, I am still trying to figure out why this movie was even made. I watched it once and I refuse to watch it again because in my mind, I like to pretend it never happened. I prefer to think of SATC finally ending with the 1st movie. This was like a bad dream. While watching this, I felt that everything we grew to love about these women was a lie. This movie was a waste of time and money. If the writers and creators thought it was good enough to satisfy the fans constant request demanding more, they were wrong. If this mess was made to make fans stop begging for more, I think it worked!

Don't look at the bad reviews. This is just an excellent dose of Sex and the City, some drama and a lot of fun! Pure delight!Exactly like in the previous film, we get to know how things have been going on for Carrie, Charllote, Miranda and, of course, Samantha. Sometimes it's all normal, sometimes a little bit dramatic and quite often wonderful and fun.I have watched all the series a few times and I must say that both films follow the same patterns regarding the storyline and the characters have evolved, little by little. I would suggest this film to all Sex and the City lovers but also to those who just want to have some fun.

reviews.review_title: it would be better for Candice Booshnell (sorry 4 wrong spell) to write a screenplay
reviews.content: after watching sex and the city we haven't had sex with my husband! got home angry for wasting money. the movie is so stupid.no idea,no good views.it wasn't enough convincing Arabian tale.when I watched it I thought - I've seen better resort in pour Egypt! but we payed 80 dollars per room, not - 22000! old woman comes to her late apartments to cry on her truly loved clothes - really stupid! this time even Pat Field's great genius didn't save the film only Samantha was a little light in. I'm very disappointed. I waited for the premiere from the moment I watched the sex and the city first movie. how could they do this to me?!

reviews.review_title: Materialism, consumption and nothing more: Avoid with a capital A.
reviews.content: Sex and the City 2 is all set-up with no pay-off.
